✨BOOK REVIEW✨

The Three Lives of Alix St Pierre by Natasha Lester

Thank you @readforeverpub for my beautiful copy.

QOTD: do you enjoy fashion? 

I’ll be honest. I do enjoy trying new fashions but I’m an online kind of girl who couldn’t tell you any of the high design brands.

I love trying new authors. It’s always a treasure when you find an author where you cannot wait to devour their entire backlist! 

I’ll definitely be reading more from Lester! 

The Three Lives of Alix took me a bit to get into. It was a little confusing going back and forth between the two perspectives since they take place around the same time and both around the fashion house….But…the more I listened the more I got invested and it finally all clicked for me.
By the end I was cheering everyone on for a beautiful finish! And let’s be honest I was here for the romance!

If you enjoy:
🇫🇷Paris Settings
🇫🇷Undercover suspense
🇫🇷Dealing with the pain of the past 
🇫🇷misunderstood to more romances
🇫🇷Fiesty, strong female MC
🇫🇷delicious slow burn chemistry between love interests 
🇫🇷Uncovering mysteries of the past

Read this book! 

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️✨

CONTENT: WW2, light strong language, one ish open door scene! Comparison to Kate Quinn or Kristin Hannah

#thethreelivesofalixstpierre #natashalester #readforeverpub #historicalfiction #historicalromance #bookstagram #2023books #bookreviewer #bookssetinparis

✨SLAYING THE VAMPIRE CONQUEROR by Carissa Broadbent✨

*SYNOPSIS IN COMMENTS*

REVIEW: Slaying the Vampire has all the gritty vibes of the original Nyaxia books but still has its own thing going for it. It gave me lots of “His Fair Assassin” vibes (one of my favorite YA series) but let’s make it more adult with vampires.

This is a fast paced book full of war plot/action, monsters, and misconceptions to more. Totally in the realm of Bridge Kingdom vibes. 

I really enjoyed the pacing, the mystery and the slow burn romance. I loved the blind magic and seeing how mental threads and searing played a part in the power. 

Content: 2 open door scenes (easy to skip and know when they are coming), moderate strong language and less than original books which I appreciated.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

✨In This Moment by @gabrielle_meyer ✨

I had to make an aesthetic reel for this one. It’s absolutely addictive and had me turning pages and is one of my favorites from 2023. I didn’t think @gabrielle_meyer could top herself…but she totally did!

One woman…the gift to live in three time periods with a possible love interest in each…what time will she choose to live more permanently in? 

This has a wonderful, natural faith element in it. I would definitely recommend reading When the Day Comes….book 1 FIRST. READ IN ORDER. 

My review is up on GR AND I’ll have a giveaway later this month. Thank you @bethanyhousefiction for the opportunity to read and continue this unique and heart stopping series.

✨BOOK FEATURE✨

NEVER FORGET YOU by Fiona Lucas 

QOTD: Do you like books that have a large time jump/gap? I don’t tend to mind anything as long as it’s done right. 

1. This cover is adorable 
2. I haven’t seen this around much so it makes me want to read it even more
3. I love a second chance at love! 

Thank you @harpercollins and @tlcbooktours I cannot wait to dive in!

🌷 S Y N O P S I S 🌷

Some love stories end before they even begin…

When Lili meets Ben by chance one hot summer’s day, it feels like fate. But life is about to take them in different directions, and so they agree to meet next July, in the beautiful hidden garden where they first laid eyes on each other. But one of them never shows up…

Five years later, Ben still wonders how he got things so wrong – he let the love of his life slip between his fingers. And then a stranger, Alice, arrives in his tiny Scottish hometown. Alice has no memory of how she got there: she can’t remember anything before that morning. The only clue to her past is the silver bee necklace she wears – the very same one Ben bought for Lili that magical summer’s day…

#fionalucas #romancebooks #neverforgetyoubook #harpercollins #bookstagram #bookfeature #tulipaesthetic #bookishflatlay #bookaccount #tlcbooktours

✨BOOK FEATURE✨ 

A Shadow Crown by Melissa Blair

**swipe to see the synopsis for book 2, A Shadow Crown.

Review for a Broken Blade (book 1): I read A Broken Blade earlier last month! This is a story about the brink of a revolution and those who want to overthrow a corrupt leader who has dictated certain races of beings to be less than. 

I enjoyed the main character as she is an assassin for a cruel ruler she despises… but still does her duty. I loved the conflict in her thought process as she hunts down a shadowed man but starts to realize that she can make her own choices and use her skills for something good! 

It’s got plenty of action, a great love interest and a solid set of side characters. 

After the great cliffhanger in book 1, I cannot wait to see what happens in A Shadow Crown!

Content: moderate violence, one open door scene, substance abuse. 

Thank you to @unionsqandco for sending me a copy of the book.

Don’t mind me trying to read Fourth Wing. I feel like I’m dodging spoilers left and right. Maybe I should just lay low on Insta until I finish! Be a kind reader and keep your detailed thoughts to yourself 😂❤️😅

Lady Charlotte Darrington’s path in life is clearly laid out before her: she will select a suitable husband, marry, and one day inherit her father’s Scottish dukedom. Her American hosts and their friends couldn’t be more welcoming—all except one. The insufferable Dr. Galloway captures her eye—and her ire.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

Engaging the Office Enemy by Kristin Canary

I think Kristin Canary has a solid voice when it comes to rom coms! Not too cheesy or silly but still lovely, funny and full of heart. 

This book was so fun I gobbled it up and finished it in less than 24 hours. I’ve done this with each of her books which shows how highly readable they are!

This one has a lot of great things going for it. Enemies to lovers, forced proximity ONE ROOM trope on a CRUISE ship, fake dating….and she does it all really well. 

Our two main characters have to pretend to be engaged to shmooze a potential job offer for Dax….so the cruise ship setting gets an A+ from me. Lots of fun activities and fun interactions with the potential bosses to be!

Engaging the Office Enemy has great banter, solid back stories and wonderful chemistry and kissing scenes! If you’re looking for a fun summer read to finish by the pool, look no further!

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

The Never Heir by @courtmillecam 

Pub: May 16th 2023
Pre Orders will get two character art prints! *link in stories 

REVIEW:
Ive never really enjoy Peter Pan reimaginings...until NOW.

The Never Heir is a historical fantasy set in a post-war 1920's. Its full of victorian vibes with the glitz of the roaring twenties. Its got so many nostalgic elements from the original Peter Pan, while still being a completely unique tale that holds its own. 

Step into a world full of magical hidden artifacts, mystery, twisted allies, duplicitous friendships, and budding romance. I loved the set up of the book and how slowly each plot element was revealed and ultimately came together. 

One of my favorite elements to the story were the boxing scenes that added high stakes and historical drama to an already great backdrop of a story. And of course we cannot forget the romance. Charlie was so easy to love and his relationship with Evie really builds quiet nicely and felt authentic to the time and the characters. 

A great balance of the sweet and the sinister to really create a tale worth reading. I CANNOT wait to see where Courtney takes this series. If you love a dash of Neverland with a historical romance vibe that still remains sweet with an sharper edge.... PICK UP THIS DEBUT BOOK!

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

Isle of the Gods by @amiekaufmanauthor 

Thank you @prhaudio and @getunderlined for my copies!

I didn’t know what to expect from Isles of the Gods but what I got far exceeding anything I could have thought of. Ive seen this slated as a SOC meets Divine Rivals and its not far from the truth while still being its own thing. 

This is an adventurous YA tale full of high seas takeovers, mystery, running from one’s past and finding connection in friendship and potentially love. This is a book that sets sail right from the start and the pacing never has a dull moment. The unlikely friendships are wonderful and the heart of the sea and mystery is woven into these pages. 

There are 4 different POVs which might seem hard to keep track of at first, but the voices are so distinct, that I honestly didn’t have a problem. We even get the POV of the villain which always adds some extra dimension and unhinged energy to the plot. 

I fell in love with each character for different reasons and felt like this was a great starting point and I can’t wait to see where the next book takes us. This book just came out and i’m already chomping at the bit to get a book 2! Adventure, high stakes, diverse characters and lovely heartfelt connection. One of my favorite YA fantasies of 2023.

CONTENT:
Romance: just kissing
Language: Light enough I can’t remember 😅
More on the true YA spectrum.

❤️MEET THE BOOKSTAGRAMMER

I think it’s been well over a year since I introduced myself! So HI! Here’s a photo of me holding some 5 star favorites from some of my favorite authors. 

I’m Lauren, the creator behind @thebookscript and I’ve been here for almost 6 years! 

My feed is heavily review based, that’s where bookSCRIPT came from. My wordy take on the books I read. 

I am an eclectic reader and you’ll almost find every genre on here but I absolutely love fantasy, historical fiction and romance.

When it comes to content I prefer closed door but you’ll find that I also read review and enjoy some open door as well. I will usually always try to put a content warning for sex and language in my reviews/swipes but I’m not perfect. 

I always try to be honest here, I DNF frequently and live off audiobooks. 

Fun facts about me:

✨I love music and was in performing arts all the way through college for singing and dancing (hence the dancing reels)
✨I’m kind of a fitness fanatic, it’s a routine part of my day and I crave physical movement
✨I love traveling, and trying new food wherever I go! 
✨I’m a huge empath, I feel big feelings and always dread hurting others. 
✨I love music, concerts, collect vinyl records and singing in my car. 
✨I’m a mom
✨I’m a dental hygienist who’s trying to kick her addiction to fruity chewy candy: current vice: sweet tart ropes
✨dream goal: be on the amazing race with my husband! 
✨I don’t watch much tv, but if I do you’ll catch me watching amazing race, survivor, GBBS, or some period/historical drama. 

Do we have anything in common?? 

Happy to be here! And it’s been fun to see how a lonely girl who needed a hobby because of a big life changing move has created life long friends and community here in this space! I’ve come a long way. 

If you ever have any questions feel free to reach out or say hi! I’m an open book and love making friends!

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

How to Kiss Your Enemy by Jenny Proctor

How to Kiss Your Enemy is the third book in the Hawthorne brothers series! While you can read them all as standalones, its been fun to read them in order and see the familial relationships and interactions build and grow between the characters! 

This was a cute quick read with two enemies who are more like rivals, a foodie/chef trope, a quaint family run farm, and competitive energy that turns more into attraction. It was fun to follow these characters as they decide what they want out of life and how to go grab it! 

Its got a food filled atmosphere set in the Carolina woods, its got some forced proximity moments with some tender heart to hearts. Low spice, cute and quick to read! If you liked the others in this series I can't see why you wouldn't enjoy this third installment. 

Thank you Jenny for my copy! I can't wait to see what you do with the rest of the series! 

Featuring @novelwicks Evelyn Hugo candle! Code SCRIPT10 saves you at checkout!

✨COOKBOOK FEATURE✨
 
QOTD: Do you guys collect anything besides books? 

My husband and I love eating, and cooking so we never turn down the opportunity to try new recipes! 

Thank you @shadowmountainpub for sending both of these my way! 

SCRUMPTIOUS by Christy Denny

We have a new cookbook releasing soon! Scrumptious from The Girl Who Ate Everything contains over 100 fast, delicious, family-friendly meals. This book combines Christy’s expert professional experience as a recipe writer for both Betty Crocker and General Mills with her life experience as a mother of five and one of ten siblings. Food is the centerpiece of family life and can be a major undertaking, requiring creativity, planning, practice, and purpose.

20-40-60-MINUTE DINNERS by Kate Otterstrom

This innovative cookbook is organized by time instead of topic, allowing you to adjust your family’s dinner needs to the time you have available.

Whether you only have twenty minutes or an hour—or something in between—you can deliver a delicious entrée and side dish to the table with these quick, easy, and crowd-pleasing recipes. Organized by “available time” rather than by “kind of dish,” this unique cookbook is designed to help the time-conscious cook with dinner planning.

Hope everyone is enjoying their Wednesday! I’m out of town all next week so doing a little catch up and then perhaps going dark. It’s much needed!

✨BOOK REVIEWS✨

Thank you @bookclubfavorites and @simon.audio for my copies

The Paris Daughter by Kristin Harmel

Harmel is a historical fiction staple, she always delivers solid, well crafted stories. This is more of a mystery based character driven story that takes place over decades. 

It’s about what mothers are willing to sacrifice in order to save their children. 

While I don’t think this will be a new favorite, I did enjoy it and found it to be an easy listen. The twist in my opinion isn’t hard to decipher, however I don’t think that took away any of my enjoyment. I loved that Harmel has two POVS and knows how to write a solid unlikeable character. I think historical fiction fans will enjoy this one! 

Thank you @shadowmountainpub for my copy!

Along a Breton Shore by Arlem Hawks

Arlem is one of my favorite HF authors. I feel like I’ve never not given one of her books 5 stars. What she excels in is full immersive scene setting, history and characters and Breton Shore is no different. I loved the themes of forgiveness, and learning to see your oppositions point of view in a new light. So many aspects of this book were incredibly well done. I just didn’t personally agree with how a couple elements were handled (a it’s me not you situation) and I don’t know if I’m ready to forgive the author for the pain she caused me 😂☠️

#QOTD: what is your favorite genre to read in the summer? I’m finding romance and fantasy have been more in my sweet spot this year!

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

Thank you @thomasnelson and @librofm for my copies

The Happy Life of Isadora Bentley by @courtneywalsh 

RIGHT BOOK, RIGHT TIME. i'm always skeptical about bucket list books but this one outdid itself. 

Adorable, quirky and heartwarming, The Happy Life of Isadora Bentley is about embracing the unknown, knowing your worth and finding love in all its forms along the way. 

If I could describe this book, it would be the love child of Catherine Center with Eleanor Oliphant. Our main character keeps herself isolated from others because feeling nothing has got to be better than feeling the crushing blow of rejection and loss right? 

What ensues is a journey for Isadora to find herself. Along the way she finds unexpected friendships, an incredibly handsome and just plain GOOD male lead (I loved him), and that the things that make us uncomfortable can bring us the most long lasting joy. This has a really lovely elderly best friend trope and its done very well. 

This is a feel good book, its got women in STEM, sweet romance secondary to Isadoras growth journey but all of it is in perfect amounts to really tell a great story. I think this now one of my favorite books from Courtney. Even though Isadora and I have opposite personalities I think the friendships where we embrace was makes us different can be the most impactful. 

All around just a freaking lovely book and perfect for summer. If you like heart warming books with great messages and content. Audio was very well done and the narration was perfectly fitting for this story.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

Garden of the Cursed by Katy Rose Pool

This book grabbed me from the first few pages. I love when a story feels like something I haven’t read before. 

Garden of the Cursed deals with magic kept in curse cards, a missing mother, and a fake dating…we used to be friends but now I don’t trust you kind of trope!

I loved the juxtaposition between the lower class marsh lands with the upper class garden society. It adds a gritty tang to the toxic polish. 

The magic system is really fun and I can’t wait to dive deeper into its machinations in the next book. I think the possibilities are endless. When magic is controlled by an elitist society, the underbelly is trying everything it can to bring them down. Gang rivalry, black market societies. It’s all here. 

Last but not least there’s a really angsty YA romance element I loved. Sure there’s miscommunication and drama but I was in it to win it. I can’t wait to see where it goes. I’m a sucker for this kind of trope. I need more! ❤️

All in all this was a solid start to a series with a great cliffhanger. A fun diverse cast, lots of growing room for future books, and just enough reveals to keep you guessing! 

I really liked it! And I will 100% be reading book 2 next year. A book that totally took me by surprise.

One of my FAVORITE reads from 2022 is now in paperback! 

It’s heartfelt and emotional and you will find yourself EDUCATED on a part of history you didn’t know before. 

Thank you @penguinteen for reaching out to me and sending me a copy! I think this is for sure one I need on my shelves! 

PAST REVIEW:

“Will You Remember Me?
A boy with wings of hope 
strapped to his back
That never had a chance to open, 
denied forever knowing
What he could have become. 
What we all could have become. 

Once Again Ruta Sepetys does not disappoint. 

I Must Betray You follows a young man as he fights in whatever small ways he can for freedom from his countries horrific communist regime. This was a quick read that genuinely pulled me in as a reader. 1980’s Romania is depicted in such a raw and realistic manner that I felt the empty bellies and broken hearts of its people. I shed tears at the cruelty and inhumanity delivered to its people by its cruel government, broken but not without heart or hope.

This book consists of short chapters that were always concise and hard hitting. I always love how Sepetys never sugar coats her characters or the experiences they go through. And the best parts are the ones they she fills with hope, from the taste of Chocolate from the feelings of romantic love. 

I Must Betrays You is a story of an entire countries pain hidden in plain view. Denied freedom, denied joy, denied possibility. It is about how small actions can change the tide of history and how big misconceptions can also ruin it. 

Highly recommend. loved it.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

It shocketh me little to see that words of Radiance has a 4.76 rating on GoodReads. Thats just a testament to the world Brandon has created and his loyal fan base who just SOAKS up everything he touches. 

Words of Radiance is SOLID GOLD. 

Originally I thought, ok I LOVED Way of Kings, so at first I was thinking that this could not possibly be better than that. Little by little, these characters just worm their way into your heart that it seems impossible you ever felt unattached in the first place. 

This book just added layers upon the already wonderful back bone from Way of Kings. There are little things that come together when you least expect them to! The twists keep on coming and the adventures never cease. The world building is incredibly epic and no one writes books like Sanderson making him seem in a league of his own (in my little unimportant humble opinion)

What I love are the characters in these books that bring so much heart and humor to every book. 

ALSO.... I am in love with Kaladin. Top tier book boyfriend material....even despite his depressive episodes. His heart is just so GOOD and full but also so loveably grumpy and I want to give him a hug. 

I loved getting more Shallan and her backstory which only made me love her and her strong spirit even more. So many humorous moments in this one that had me laughing. 

GAHHH I always tell myself i'll immediately pick up the next book but then I get distracte....but I can't wait to continue this incredible journey. Don't be intimidated. This book is chunky but definitely…

WORTH IT.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

Betting on the Best Friends Brother by @melaniejacobson_books 

I finished this book back in June so this one’s long over due! 

In pure Melanie style she puts the com in rom and delivers with a fun, sexy, yet sweet story about unrequited love, missed chances and future possibilities!

I loved our two main characters! Ava is no non sense and intelligent scientist but can’t deny her unrequited crush. Joey is her best friends brother…he’s charismatic and cute but he sure is clueless. 

I loved the little moments created where the characters flirt and interact and Melanie always knows how to write a good kissing scene! This couple had real chemistry together. Anytime someone coaches someone on dating you know it’s going to backfire! But in the best way. 

There’s also a bit of makeover trope but I loved that Ava was seen for her wit and humor!

All in all this was my favorite of the series so far! I don’t love grand gestures (I’m more of a quiet love girl) so the ending reveal was not to my preference but it definitely fits the genre! I think I just wanted a little more solo Joey and Ava time! BUT I just can’t wait for you know who’s comeuppance 😂

Thank you @melaniejacobson_books ! This series is perfectly bingeable for summertime. AND a whole lot of fun!

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

House of Roots and Ruin by Erin A Craig.

Thank you @getunderlined for my finished copy and @prhaudio 💕

This is the companion novel to Salt and Sorrows. You do not have to read the first to enjoy the second. I have not read Salt so I can attest to this 😂

This book was an interesting tale. It has an eerie atmosphere, and the author was great at setting the scene and creating this facade where you know something super vile lurks underneath.

It has a romance aspect that while I enjoyed, but it never felt fully polished due to some of the other choices the author creates for the main character. Which was disappointing. 

I did feel like even though this is a big book, it’s incredibly readable, and the audio is fantastic. It’s a story full of mystery, crooked motives and shadows in the hallways. 

The ending was unsettling and definitely horror like so I hope I get a sequel for this to get some much needed closure! 

I liked it, and would read another by this author. 

* I do have to note that there is some content that felt way too lusty and over the top that didn’t serve much of a purpose for me in the plot other than to be sensual so my personal preference would be to not give this to a young teen.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

Hello Stranger by Katherine Center

Thank you @smpromance and @stmartinspress for my book and @macmillan.audio for my listening copy!!!

QOTD: Do you have a favorite hobby besides reading?

REVIEW: I'm a simple girl, I see a Katherine Center book, I know I have to read it. This is my third Katherine Center book this year, and there's just something comforting yet emotionally captivating about each one of her books. 

Hello Stranger is a story about an artist who loses her ability to see faces. A condition caused by an accident that makes faces appear more like jumbled puzzle pieces. This forces a lot of chaotic energy and misconceptions into her life and perhaps a little love too. 

This was just a super fun and heart warming read. I loved Sadie's journey of connection, not only to herself but to her mom and those around her. Because she can't see faces, she's forced to see things in a new creative lights. There is a message of hope amongst all the hardship in every one of Center's books and this was no exception. There's always a romance that secondary to the growth plot and he was a total gem...this brought many sweet little moments that will warm your insides. 

Unpopular opinion alert: The Bodyguard was a bit too goofy for me (I know that was the intent and I still enjoyed it) but so I was happy to see Center return to more of a heartfelt, emotionally dense story that i've come to know and love from her other books. Don't get me wrong, this still had a touch of silliness but it was lovable and I embraced it. I loved the quirkiness and whimsy that accompanied the bittersweet. 

Overall a wonderful read, and perfect for summer!

There was a little bit of lag in a few areas for me but overall a very enjoyable experience! 

I wonder what guide Sophie will put out next!

QOTD: who’s an author who writes great angst in romance? 

I lost sleep over this book. 

I’m always looking for new historical romance authors who fit my reading preferences and now I have a new author for my go to list!

This book is one full of emotion, character growth that feels organic to the situation, humor, FAB angst and chemistry that will keep your eyes glued to the page!

✨BOOK FEATURE✨

The Blackthorn Queen by @karsakmelanie 

Do you enjoy political intrigue in books?

I do! It’s one of my favorite aspects and done well it only amplifies a story and the stakes! 

This one is for fans of Game of Thrones! This is the newest drop on my kindle and I am certainly intrigued. 

SYNOPSIS: Britain, AD 38, Princess Cartimandua—Carti—of the Brigantes tribe faces an uncertain future when her father’s sudden death ignites turmoil. Suspicion falls on the Crow People of the Votadini tribe, straining the fragile peace between the factions. But they’re not the only ones bearing a grudge. A tangled web of political games soon unfolds. When enigmatic Prince Cormag of the Votadini shows the princess unwanted attention, the Brigantes’ alliance with the Carvetti is shaken. Cartimandua’s dream of marrying gallant Prince Venutiux of the Carvetti is put at risk. Soon, Carti finds herself at the center of a whirlwind of divided loyalties. Yet amidst the misty forests and the blackthorn trees, the Cailleach, the ancient dark goddess of the Brigantes people, whispers that all is not as it seems. With the fate of her tribe at stake, Carti must learn to navigate the treacherous waters of politics, duty, magic, and love. From New York Times bestselling author Melanie Karsak, The Blackthorn Queen transports readers to northern Celtic Britain on the precipice of the second Roman invasion, introducing us to Cartimandua, princess of the powerful Brigantes tribe.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

The Wall of Winnipeg and Me by Mariana Zapata

Thank you @avonbooks and @librofm for my copies

QOTD: What’s the last book you were hesitant to try but ended up loving?

I have been so hesitant to try Marianna due to the hype surrounding her books. BUT I love a chunky book so I decided to go all in once I obtained the new audio rendition too.

AND I just really freaking enjoyed it! For those of you who love trope comparisons this is a grumpy sunshine with a marriage of convenience. 

Now let me tell you...I am not a fan of fake dating/contemporary marriage of convenience because I have to hear, "he/she is pretending...its not real...over and over within the book" BUT i'm happy to tell you that this does not happen here! This is a story about two adults going in and having a really natural progression of feelings and changes of heart. 

Don't get me wrong, Aiden is a pretty clueless a-hole at the beginning of this story, but the small changes, and bread crumbs that culminate to them falling in love is very organic and felt like it was something that would happen in reality. 

This book has great moments of interaction, beautiful 
moments of romance, fun nicknames, and a slow burn that feels realistic and heartfelt. Really loved this and can't wait to try Rhodes next! 

*I’ve got to say the new covers are really cute! I’ve read the book and I still feel the same 😂😂😂

✨HAPPY PUB DAY REVIEW✨

Light Bringer by Pierce Brown (book 6 in the Red Rising series)

Well, this bloody damn behemoth of a book just became my favorite of the year. 

I hope everyone finds their book. The one that gives them midnight runs to borders vibes, the one that makes you read way past your bedtime and the one that becomes all consuming you don’t even care if people think you are weird for loving something so much. 

This series is that book for me. 

This is a also a spoiler free review because…spoilers are for pixies. 

Light Bringer is an absolute gift to the series as a whole, and probably my new favorite of the bunch. It is full of non stop action and brings back the found family flame in full force. But it also doesn’t lose the grit and explosive world building that started in book 4. 

With odes of nostalgia to the earlier books, it will take you through the full spectrum of emotion. I laughed, I cried, I hated, I mourned, but most of all….I hoped. There is so much complexity and emotional nuance to this one. I soaked it in. 

I loved every second of this book that I dragged it out and didn’t want it to end. The ending basically broke me open (luckily no one was there to see my ugly crying) 😂 but also filled me with a sense of hope and the need for more. Pierce knows how to pack a solid punch, but it was beautifully done 

I need Red God immediately.

I don’t know how he does it, but folks…he’s done it again.  These books aren’t for everyone but if you’re a howler…(insert howl here 🐺)

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

Immortal Longings by Chloe Gong

Would you join a life or death game for an ultimate prize?

Thank you @simon.audio and @bookclubfavorites for my copies!

This is a quick paced, violent story full of stabby wit, vengeful characters, and a dark city landscape. It is built off the concept of body jumping...so your body is never your own and anyone could take it over to inhabit in flash. Fans of hunger games, scythe, and squid games vibes will enjoy this one as Chloe does a great job creating a gritty urban back drop and making you think of the moral implications of this type of magic system. 

I just personally felt this would have been better off pushed and written as a Young Adult novel. The games were fairly straightforward/simplistic. I wanted to know more about the foundation of them, the rules, the boundaries...it was a very generic anything goes scenario. I also was a little underwhelmed by the pacing of the romance. It went 2 to 20 and I just didn't buy into the chemistry as a personal slow burn fan. I also really wanted more of a solid villain and political landscape. We are supposed to hate this guy and he gets like 10 pages of face time and a weak revenge plot. The dialogue also reads fairly YA, so the sex and language just felt a bit off putting for me personally. 

All in all I was underwhelmed, BUT I still enjoyed Chloe’s writing style and can see why her other books are well loved. The ending had some fun twists (predictable and not) that made me want to pick up the next book, so i'm hoping it can only go up from here!

The more time I spend on here the more I come to realize the sources of my anxiety and loss of peace. 

Social media would have you glued to your phone all day. It would have you looking over your shoulder, comparing yourself, over analyzing silly things, telling yourself you’re not enough. Showing you numbers over people with faces and feelings. 

Sometimes bookstagram makes reading feel like a rat race, but I PROMISE..your review is just as valid months late, your perspective is just as powerful. 

Sometimes you’re searching for connection when you forget to connect with the people who love you who are standing right next to you.

As much as I love it here, I have found that other sources make me feel more valid, loved and give me a greater sense of peace. It’s fun here, but I never want to place too much value in it. 

So when it comes to bookstagram, read the books or don’t read the books, create the safe spaces with the people who know your heart, and create for the joy of it. 

And when you lose that? 

Log off, talk a walk, go somewhere new, call up a friend and tell them you appreciate them and feel that peace come flooding back. When my priorities feel skewed or my children start to feel like they are “in the way”…I know that my attention has been spent where it shouldn’t. 

Take the break, and thank me later. 

What practices help you stay grounded while using social media?

Currently reading: One Kiss Alone by @nicholevan and Foxglove by Adalyn Grace

• BOOK REVIEW •

HER RADIANT CURSE by Elizabeth Lim

I think this is one of the best prequel stories i've read in a long time! 

Her Radiant Curse is about the history that happens before the Six Crimson Cranes duology, and it's everything I expected and much more. Just when I thought I knew the ending because I've read the successor story, the author still managed to surprise me with the unexpected. 

Lim has a wonderful writing style that amplifies the magic and lore. Her writing is beautifully descriptive and evocative as she blends a story full of curses, sisterhood, and identity. Channi is a complex character full of bravery, loyalty and inner strength. I loved getting to know her backstory which I felt like really added depth to her entire journey. 

If you love well written stories that lean slightly on tragedy, and don't lack in emotional gravity then this is one prequel I would not sleep on. I feel like you could read this before or after the duology and be just fine.

Thank you @getunderlined & @prhaudio for my audio copy! Highly recommend the immersive reading route, the performance was very well done!.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

This Dark Descent by Kalyn Joseph 
PUB: September 26 2023

Are you looking for a book with...

- Magical high stakes horse racing
- Peaky blinders meets the Scorpio Races
- Jewish based magic and folklore
- Dual POV diverse characters
- Dangerous secrets and unbridled power

This Dark Descent is an upper YA book that brings all the gritty atmosphere of the underbelly of a city mixed with the highlife of the upper elite. It has great morally grey characters, some even unlikable..but honestly in the best of ways that really made them all the more interesting. 

This is a great book for fall and if you like horse elements in this story, then this one is for you. I love that danger was always lurking around every corner which made for a really fast paced book when everyone has something to lose. Every character is a little hell bent with something to prove which makes them interesting and when you bring them together the group dynamic is fantastic to read. 

 With multiple potential romances, hot headed arrogant male leads )but also softer ones), and never knowing who to trust. This Dark Descent is one to add to your TBR. 

I LOVE Reid. More of him please. 

“I will never tell you to not be angry. When the world has taken so much form you, sometimes anger is all you have left. But if you do nothing with it, it will consume you.”

Can’t wait to see where the next book takes us.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

The Art of Love and Lies by Rebecca Anderson

If you love sweet historical romance, the art world and an occasional heist…this might be for you. 

When an independent artist gets caught up in a smuggling scandal, it might be the thing that drives a wedge between her and newfound love…especially when you’re on opposite sides of the law.

Rebecca had wonderful wit and I really enjoyed the aspects relating to art, it’s creation, and the history behind it. The romance is also quick paced, and has some great flow and witty conversation. 

I enjoyed the change of pace, and found this one to be breath of fresh air and a unique premise. While the ending was a bit too quick and straightforward it’s a book you could easily binge.

✨REVIEW TIME✨

The Fall Back Plan by Melanie Jacobson is the second book in the Sweater Weather sweet romance series. (all are stand-alone books by different authors)

Welcome to Harvest Hollow where you can expect small town romance, a sheriff who gets a second chance and a new bar owner who's back in town to make a new name for herself. 

This is a story of second chances, forgiveness and about how two people finally dig up the unfinished past so that it can finally be buried for good. 

My favorite part of this book was the mature communication addressing the damages and hurt done in the past. I loved that I could feel the maturity that comes from over a decade of growth and space apart. I also loved the themes of exploring what poverty looks like in different homes, and how small towns play into those relationships. 

This also includes a guardianship situation that really was super sweet. It showed the softer more vulnerable sides to both of our main characters and provides a sweet family theme to the overall plot. 

Its fun and flirty and provides all the light hearted feels for falling in love…in the fall. 

Content: just kissing, light moderate swears.

✨One Kiss Alone by Nichole Van

"A kiss is a communion. An exchange of spirit right along with breath."

I'm a simple fan girl. I see a Nichole Van book, I read it, hyper obsess over every character and then mourn getting to the close. 

One Kiss Alone is the love story of a highland poet and the lady he can't get out of his head

Something that I admire about Nichole's books and this one especially is that each of her characters feels like they have their own unique personality and backstories. Never do you feel like one is a cookie cutter of another, and never is one love story quite the same. One Kiss Alone examines a passionate kind of love, which is ultimately so fitting for two characters with large personalities. 

I love the Scottish history and detail poured into this book. Having just visited I could clearly see the winding staircases, dark corridors and highland atmosphere. Allie and Ethan are both unforgettable characters battling for being truly seen in a world that would only have them for what they can provide. 

The push and pull is delicious, the banter is quick, and the romance is added in heaping measure. I had a hard time putting this one down and really enjoyed the choices made when it came to plot and character development. 

PICK THIS UP. (please start with book one because they are all truly some of my all time favorite historical romances) I don't fan girl this hard unless I mean it!

REVIEW: UNDER THE JAVA MOON by Heather B Moore

If you are always looking for unique WW2 stories listen up! 

This is a survival story about a Dutch family living in the Dutch East Indies and what happens when it becomes occupied by Japan. 

This will take you through hard moments of survival but highlight the incredible strength of the human spirit. 

This is a 3 POV story and the author did her research. Many of the memories are from a survivor she was able to interview personally. 

It brought tears to my eyes especially as a mother thinking of what parents had to endure and do for the sake of their children. It broke my heart to see the realities of the war. But it also gave me a great perspective and I really enjoyed being educated on this part of the conflict. 

Thank you @shadowmountainpub for my copy! The review is completely my own.

If you are looking for your next VAMPtatsic read, look no further!

The Scarlet Veil is full of dark gothic atmosphere, vampires, murder mystery, ghostly figures, and page turning suspense.

And while this is a break off from the Serpent & Dove series, I don’t think it’s 100% necessary to have read the other books. The author does an excellent job at filling in the blanks like breadcrumbs throughout this story. Having some context to the past characters helped me though, (even just by reading book one) 

This CHUNK is over 600 pages, but not once does it feel like it. I was turning pages and couldn’t wait to find out what would happen & the pacing was fabulous. I really loved the introduction of new characters and loved Celie as a main character as she uncovers the true source of her power and strength.

I do think this story is more mystery than romance focused, but I really enjoyed both aspects and the romance gave me just enough that I can’t wait to see where it’s going to head next. 

If you like spooky atmosphere, vampires, sumptuous, undertones, and a dash of romance, with a whole lot of mystery then I would not hesitate to tell you to pick this one up. That cliffhanger has me some type of way (SO GOOD) and I am dying to get my hands on book two!

Thank you @epicreads for my copy!

✨ BOOK REVIEW ✨

CROSS COUNTRY WEDDING by Courtney Walsh

This is such a fun summer romance with odes to the first book "Cross Country Christmas" while still having its own original plot and flare. 

I have to say that friends to lovers is my favorite trope. It's a hard one to pull off but I feel like when it's done well i'm a goner. This book gave me some of the same vibes I felt in People We Meet on Vacation. Mostly due to Simon. Simon as a MMC is my book boyfriend kryptonite. Soft, sweet, slightly nerdy and sensitive to the needs around him. I was slightly nervous that Maddy would never come around enough to deserve him. Honestly...I'm not sure WHO is deserving of such a wonderful character...but she finally sees the light! 

This is a book that is full of YEARS of unrequited pining and love. Will a road trip be the "hail mary" that finally makes or break a relationship? I was so anxious to see when Maddy would finally wake up and see what she's been missing all along. I really enjoy the forced proximity of a road trip which provides lots of character interaction and a lot of fun silly moments between our two characters and some really fun romantic ones too! 

Courtney always delivers a really fun story and this one is no exception. I loved the themes of sometimes love and willingness to fall comes down to a matter of timing. I'm really head over hills for Simon, and I can't wait for you to read it and fall for him too!

Can’t wait to read @courtneywalsh new fall romance soon!

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

The Forest Grimm by Kathryn Purdie

You say the words inspired by Grimm's Fairytales and i'm so there. 

When the forest is fanged creature that holds the secrets to saving your mother...the only option is to embark within its midsts, even if they lead to your foretold doom. The Forest Grimm is a story about cursed fortunetelling cards, creatures that are not quite as they appear, and soft romantic love waiting to bloom. 

I loved the eerie character of the forest and not knowing what our main characters would encounter next. Clara was a wonderful main character and I really enjoyed the softer romance aspect with the sweetest love interest. This is an engaging, haunted story and I can't wait to see what will happen next! 

The Forest Grimm is a wonderful example of why I love YA fantasy with just a touch of dark undertones. Its the perfect spooky read for fall, and has content that I could recommend to wide audience. I love the authors interpretation of each fairytale that ultimately made this book come alive. It was magic, a bit disturbing and ultimately just a really fun time! 

thank you @wednesdaybooks and @macmillan.audio for my copies. I really loved the narration for the audiobook!

What fairytale would you like to see the aftermath of?

After the Forest by Kell Woods

🍂REVIEW🍂

After the Forest is a Handle and Gretel retelling of what comes after the witches horrific gingerbread house. The characters feel authentic and Greta as a main character is one that you can’t help but love as she goes on a discovery to find who she truly is. 

It’s a story full of curses, witches, rumors and dark magic that reads like your favorite twisted fairytale. It reminded me of books like Uprooted or Bear and the Nightingale. It felt adult in context and world building and it’s a wonderful read for this time of year. I really enjoyed the added richness of the historical undertones that added complexity to the story. 

I could tell you the detailed contents but I think it’s best if you go in blind! If you enjoy dark fairytales, dashes of romances, unraveling mystery and historical fantasy settings I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this one!

This is such a well done debut that I wouldn’t hesitate to pick up this authors next book.

FLAME AND SPARROW UNBOXING

The newest release from S.M. Gaither

This is probably one of the most amazing PR boxes I’ve opened! So many wonderful pieces that coincide with the book, from character art to useful every day items. 

HERE’S THE SYNOPSIS:
On the eve of her twentieth birthday, Karys woke to the sight of a divine creature dying outside her home.

Two weeks later, her sister disappeared, leaving nothing but a trail of blood in her wake.

Convinced the gods were responsible for the disappearance, Karys has spent the past five years plotting her revenge with the help of a cutthroat band of like minded rebels. So when Dravyn—one of her world’s most powerful deities—descends upon her kingdom in search of humans worthy of serving him, Karys knows what she must do. Earning a place at the god’s side will allow her to find out what truly happened to her sister…and then destroy the gods from the inside out for what they did.

Thrown into the dazzling but deadly world of the divine courts, she must navigate complicated politics, strange magic, and dangerous trials to prove herself worthy of standing among the gods.

Among the most dangerous of those trials is Dravyn himself.

Karys knows better than to trust the enigmatic God of Fire. The flames of passion that stir between them are only divine trickery. And yet, the more she learns about him, the hotter the forbidden sparks burn. The more she begins to question all she thought she knew about the world of gods and mortals and everything in-between.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

The Night Hunt by Alexandra Christo

Do you have a favorite monster?

🍂🍂🍂

"There is darkness in me, I repeat."

"Look around Atia..."Where there is darkness, there are also stars."

Sometimes you just need a book about a monstrous girl who feed on the fears of other to survive. 

AND, then you might need a little romance as she teams up with her enemy/hindrance to defeat corrupt gods and fulfill a bargain that will give each what they have been long looking for. 

Throw in a band of misfits, creatures a plenty, a grand adventure and a curse breaking quest and you have yourself a solid standalone that will give plenty of fun to keep you entertained. 

Its always a treat to read a book and feel like you haven't read something like it before. The Night Hunt contains elements of mythology as it goes back and forth between Atia and Silas' POVs. I enjoyed Atia as a main character. She's tough as nails but also just has this sweet center that is desperate for belonging and love which is refreshing and relatable. 

The pacing is great and even though the overall themes are somewhat dark, there is more focus on the sweeter themes of friendship, lasting love, choosing your own family, and finding your destiny. 

This was a great standalone and I really wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to someone looking for a fast fun read.

Thank you @fiercereads @coloredpagesbt and @alexandrachristowrites for my copy!

I don’t expect perfection. 

I don’t expect perfection from myself in order to love who I am…

I don’t expect perfection from others in order to love who they are…

So, I don’t expect it from the books I read either. 

Perfection is a boring standard anyway. 

I think imperfection is actually actually key to what makes us human. Authors are imperfect people writing the stories that sit closest to their hearts and once we realize that we might come to better understand the directions the story went. 

So if there’s a flaw in book or a couple of things I might not like….I can still rate a book a solid five because of the practically perfect experience it gave me. 

Life is hard. Why are we so hard on the books we are reading? 

Just some food for thought for your day. Because as always my words are simply my opinion.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

A Study in Drowning by Ava Reid

I came for the dark academia but stayed for the poetic prose, the damp & cold atmospheric setting, and the way that Reid crafted a compelling story out of a dark fairytale. The writing is effortlessly romantic and it's the type of story you just settle into and enjoy like a warm drink on a brisk fall day. 

This is a heavier story and one that examines what it means to be a survivor, and how it can feel like you're barely coming up for air when your past keeps you haunted at night. It's also a book about nightmares, and how the things we fear most could be hiding in plain sight. BUT ultimately it's a book about healing from the trauma left in a monsters wake. I loved how this had a historical tone to it including the folklore pertaining to the different regions that added more layers to the story. 

Effy is a beautifully crafted character full of passion and self reflection. I enjoyed how the author tackled a tougher subject and brought it to light. I loved the slow building relationship between her and Preston as they work together to unravel a mystery surrounding a popular author's life work. Their relationship was beautiful and heart felt and grew in a way that I felt it in my bones. 

With a mix of romance, horror, atmosphere and mystery....A Study in Drowning is one story I really enjoyed although I do not think it will appeal to everyone!

I was just really impressed with this authors writing style! Can't wait to see what she does next!

AUDIO NOTE: the audio was read by Saskia Maarleveld and she knocked it out of the park!

✨BOOK REVIEW & FEATURE✨

BETWEEN US by Mhairi McFarlane 
⭐️⭐️⭐️✨

I liked this but I didn't love it. 

More than a romance, this is a story about a break up. And while Mhairi always does a fabulous job building friendships, keeping her audience earnest, and creating a sub plot romance worth rooting for...this overall content is just not my favorite to read. 

This book involves a lot of talk about cheating, the moral implications of it...and the different types that humans participate in. I also thought the parallels between the gritty sex crazed tv show persona in the book were scary similar to realities on tv today. We consume content that we don't condone in real life but then say we are ok with it, but what does that truly say about us as a society as a whole? Just some food for thought. There was one instance that didn't sit well with me that I can't go into for spoilers sake. 

I do think Mhairi is fire as a writer. This book contains all her quintessential British humor that occasionally goes over my head, and I truly fell hard for her romantic love she peppered throughout, although I do wish she would have spent more time developing it and less time on the other prominent aspect. 

The main characters are flawed and thoughtful and easy to love. I think she told the story she wanted to and did it well...but ultimately its not one of my favorites from her.

MAYBE ONCE, MAYBE TWICE by Allison Rose Greenberg 

I’m hoping this one is a case of wrong book wrong time. I got 20% in and there was just way too much innuendo and language that it pulled me out of the story. I’m going to hang on to it and maybe try again because I’ve seen so many awesome reviews for this. I just didn’t have the immediate connection and I’m setting it aside for now. 

I’ve heard this is a love triangle full of angst, heart break, and second chances! It actually sounds like something I’d love so maybe one day when I’m less grumpy. 😂

✨SERIES REVIEW✨

Once Upon a Broken Heart by Stephanie Garber

I have had this book on my shelves for FAR TOO LONG! I am so happy I finally picked it up and also happy about the fact that I have zero wait and can binge the trilogy in its entirety. 

This is a spin off of the Caraval series which in my little opinion should be read first before diving into this one. What can I say...i'm a stickler for publication storyline order and I think the pay off is worth it. 

This one has the same magical vibes and whimsy but feels like a new world all its own. When I finished the Caraval series I fell in love with Jacks and it was a dream come true to be able to get a series with him as a main character. 

I also really enjoyed the main female character. She is sweet and hopeful and yearns to be loved. She yearns for a happily ever after. It is a fresh change of pace from the usual “back off i'm snarky” vibes from FMC's and I was happy to get a character who felt relatable and kind. I believe her strength was in the way she believed the best of others. 

Someone called this a "cotton candy" fantasy, and that feels quite accurate. I loved all the zany elements that almost feel Alison and Wonderland-esque but still have some grit and darkness to them. There are magical arches, and blood sucking vampires, to glittering balls and the intricacies of court. Its easy to see why this is a fan favorite. 

I really enjoyed all the books and was happy with how it all became wrapped up in the end! 

Have you read any Garber books yet?

It has those childhood rivals vibes with misunderstandings, fun chemistry and those moments when it all starts to shift into something more. 

A really quick read for the rom com reader who wants to jump into the holiday season! This has the great romantic tension that we have come to know and love in Esther’s books that makes for an enjoyable, fun read!

✨SYNOPSIS✨
The search for the Ivory Key has brought royal siblings Vira, Ronak, Kaleb, and Riya closer than they have been in years as they try to restore magic and stability to Ashoka. But despite finally getting their hands on the long-lost key, uncovering its cipher has proved more complicated and dangerous than they ever expected.

Their missions force them to split up and disperse them across Ashoka and beyond. When a rash decision by the council strips Vira of her power, her journey to reclaim her throne takes on new meaning. Kaleb travels to the neighboring country of Lyria to uncover its emperor’s motives and meets a prince seeking answers of his own. Ronak’s efforts to escape his arranged marriage and exonerate his brother lead to a series of risky deals that only bring him closer to what he’s running from. And Riya’s newfound power has turned unpredictable, but her search for answers only raises more questions.

When their attempts at decoding the key release an ancient power, the siblings must align to face the past and save their future once and for all. In a quest that culminates in a deadly labyrinth, there’s only one way they will succeed: together.

✨SKYWARD SERIES✨

Calling all YA sci fi adventure fans! 

Have you read the Skyward series by Brandon Sanderson??

It’s one of my all time favorite YA book series. My husband and I have been buddy reading them together (including the novellas…which we think are mandatory) and it’s been a blast to chat about them!

These books are funny and full of friendship and great messaging. They start in a flight school setting but with each book the world and the characters continue to expand and grow! 

I love how you can never predict what will happen book to book and I love each surprise reveal. This series has some seriously endearing characters, quirky humor, fantastic AI, and non stop action. 

I can’t wait to read the final book Defiant, releasing NOV 21, and see the series wrap up! This is the perfect series for YA readers of all ages with content to match. 🥰

All books have received an unapologetic ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ from me.

THE GOOD PART by Sophie Cousens 

Thank you @prhaudio for my audiobook!

There is no way this wont be a top favorite for me this year. 

I have been a fan of Sophie’s books for a while now and I think this one just became my new favorite. 

The Good Part is about what happens when we skip our current hardships to get to the “good stuff”. Lucy is tired of her current circumstances. When she makes a wish on an antique wishing machine she ends up getting WAY more than she bargained for. She wakes up the next morning with a ring on her hand, children running around her home and a man who is a complete stranger but is apparently...her husband. Can skipping a large chunk of her life be a blessing or is skipping to the Good Part all its cracked up to be?

I think this is one of most endearing books i’ve read this year. The relationships explored in this book are tender and sentimental. It made me want to examine how I treat the people most important to me in my own life and be a better person. 

I loved the dynamics between Lucy when it came to her interactions with her future family. There were multiple moments I laughed, swooned, and yes...I totally cried. Sophie has written one of the most realistic seven year olds, and man oh man the romantic relationship was a 10/10.

 I loved the themes of realizing that the things that are hard actually lead us to the good stuff and if we don’t remember them can we truly appreciate the here and now. 

I can’t say enough good things but I loved this one from start to finish. If you add one book to your wishlist this year for Christmas, let it be The Good Part. You won’t regret it. 

audiobook was incredibly well done. So much so that I immediately went out and bought a hardcopy for my trophy shelves.

#bookish #bookstagram #thegoodpart #sophiecousens #favorite2023books #readersofig #bookstagrammer #bookreview #bookreviewer #womensfiction

AN IMPROPER SCHEME by Audra Wells

I always know when I pick up an Audra Wells book, i'm in for a good time. I love her writing style that makes her plots entertaining and her characters incredibly endearing. 

An Improper Scheme takes a more conventional approach to characters and romance and I think thats what made me love it all the more. I'm in the opinion that not every male love interest needs to be tortured with a dark past. Henry is plagued by nightmares, of the pressure of not ever being good enough (something that feels HIGHLY relatable). I love that we are given this seemingly "boring would be side character" and giving him the spotlight. I love that everyone has a story and let’s be honest...this is the type of MMC that we want to bring home to momma. 

This romance is sweet, with little moments of angst and vulnerability. It's about making mistakes but then growing from them. It's a story of slow growing friendships. And most importantly this is a story about realizing how worthy of love you are, and that you don't have to be anyone else  but yourself in order to deserve it. 

I loved the side character cameos as well and overall this was just a sweet delightful read. 

I recommend reading the series in order even if these can be read as standalones. I cannot wait to see what Audra does next. 

I am going LIVE with Audra on Thursday night at 8pm. So hope to see you guys there 🥰

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

The One With the Kiss Cam by Cindy Steel

Some books just feel like coming home, and The Kiss Cam is one them. From start to finish I had a goofy smile on my face and adored my front row seat to watching Nora fall in love. 

What would you if you had one night, a crazy wager, and the guts to do it all? 

The Kiss Cam is rom com but it’s more than that. It’s an incredibly heartfelt and tender story about learning to love, allowing others to take on your burdens and realizing the best parts of falling in love come naturally. 

Cindy has mastered witty dialogue and flirting. I think one of my favorite parts about her writing is that it gives me real life nostalgia — I find myself thinking about those days I’ve spent time with my own family, playing outdoors, and finding romance and silliness in small & simple moments. 

I love how her characters have true discussions and are free with their feelings and emotions. Cindy creates romance and tension out of real life scenarios that feel authentic to the characters and makes them come alive on the page.

I finished this book with tears in my eyes. I love it so much and it came right at a time I needed it. A very huggable book. Lots of stars…you’ll need this one.

Thank you @authorcindysteel love you

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

Flirtation or Faceoff by Leah Brunner

Leah has created another hockey romance full of fun, flirty banter, annoyance to more, and easy chemistry. 

I love that I can enjoy a hockey romance that still feels a little edgy while remaining closed door. This book… like the first, has many of the hockey teammate dynamics that we love but the romance has a different vibe that separates it from the first. 

I loved that Colby was willing to do whatever it took to get the girl and that leads to some very fun and adorable moments throughout the story.

I love a flirty jock meets a more studious teacher vibe and this created a fun dynamic. Can you trust a flirt with a reputation? Can anyone really change? Are sweater vests all they are cracked up to be?

Flirtation and Faceoff is about persistent pursuits, tough jocks with softer insides, sexy sweet tension and proving that the right person can make ALL the difference. 

I love Leah's hockey books and if you want more sports romance, then this is what I would tell you to pick up!

Thank you @leah.brunner.writes and @netgalley for making my reading experience possible!

If you’re looking for a quick, holiday read with minimal angst but all the sweet romance, kisses and Christmas vibes then this book is for you! 

Coming in at under 200 pages, Cocoa kisses is about small town community, long term friends to more, meddling family members and realizing the love of your life has been right in front of you all along. 

There was an easy, comfortable chemistry and friendship between Taylor and Levi. With it being almost novella size in length I did feel like the pacing was great and kept me entertained throughout. I enjoyed the race to save Christmas and the heartwarming themes that came with it.

❄️WAITING FOR DECEMBER by Riley Costello❄️

Love Triangle Ladies, this one is for you! 

I went in blind and this was a great surprise for me! This was a book is about starting over, and realizing what real love feels like and how it’s worth fighting for.

When Harper loses her job and her fiance, she decides to go find herself by flying back to her hometown in Vermont and taking up a cozy inn gig. She doesn’t expect to find love on the airplane...and then find it again where she least suspects it. 

This book that had me turning pages and put me in emotional turmoil (which honestly I loved), just when I thought I was in love with one character, I fell even harder for another to a point where I was going to throw my book if he wasn’t end game.😂

There were a lot of sweet, heartfelt moments, and this one was quite the slow burn! I was totally a goner for one of the men and I think it would be nearly impossible not to fall for him with everything going on in the book. Grade A book boyfriend material. 

If you like stories with more emotional weight to them, I highly recommend this one! It gave me the emotional plight like bachelorette does..and while I loathe that show...I did not loathe this experience, daresay I enjoyed it very much! 

*light strong language, fade to black with some build up.

EMERGENCY CONTACT BUDDY READ!

One of our goals this year to grow closer was to read one book a month together! One of the stipulations is that it HAS to have some kind of romance. I love discussing the plot points and what we liked and disliked and how we can relate as a couple! We loved this experience so much we decided on a second read this month… Snowed In by Catherine Walsh.

🎄Laurens Review:
This short, fast paced book is sure to put a smile on your face this Christmas season. 

This is my second divorced/second chance romance written by a married couple and this dynamic might be my favorite thing. 

This story was funny! Just when you think one more thing can’t go wrong, it totally does. I loved the pointed banter back and forth that sometimes led to realizations. This book made a hard trope work and made each person think about all the loose ends and all the things they left unsaid. 

The chemistry was great, the laughs were there, the pacing was fantastic and all in all I 100% recommend this Christmas romance!

A WINTER BY THE SEA by Julie Klassen 

REVIEW + AESTHETIC

Julie’s writing always feels like a modern day classic. I love the attention to historical detail and the purposeful mentions of everyday life detail that only add additional layers to each story. A Winter By the Sea is a story about finding your purpose and realizing that the things we hope and pray for...might not always be the things we truly need. 

The On Devonshire Shores series is truly a delight. I love that it forces me to slow down and soak in all the little details of friendship, sisterhood, love, all wrapped up in a cozy seaside setting. This story has a main character focus but still has a great focus on the relationships between the siblings as they navigate this new change in station. 

I loved how we were introduced to many wonderful characters to add to the ones we already fell in love with. There is something about the close proximity of these characters that brings a cozy found family feel to every story. 

The romance aspect of this book had me turning pages...at one point I was seriously concerned things would not end in my favor BUT the ending pulled through to a truly wonderful finish. The romance is just angsty enough while still being sweet, wholesome and totally worth cheering for. This was one of my favorite aspects of the book. 

I cannot wait to see what Julie does with the other sisters storylines because there are a few loose ends id love to see comfortably tied! 

Im a fan! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

LOVE, HOLLY by EMILY STONE

One of my newest favorite holiday reads! 

Love, Holly is the kind of book that will fill your cup while simultaneously pouring it out. It is a lovely story with themes of forgiveness, family, love, and how small choices can create huge life consequences. If you love books with found family relationships...this one is brilliant. 

I loved Holly from page one as she navigates her life and how a huge accident change the trajectory of her family relationships. This push and pull of grief and loss was very touching. It’s the kind of book that made me want to go hug my sisters and cling to the love we share.

WHAT THE RIVER KNOWS BY Isabel Ibanez

Welcome to Egypt....where the allure is high, you can taste magic in the air, everyone is keeping secrets and there is ALWAYS a new mystery to uncover. 

“How is it that a moment ago, I wanted to strangle you, but now I feel like laughing?”

“It’s part of my charm”

What the River Knows follows our main character Inez as she defiantly follows in her deceased parents footsteps to Egypt where she attempts to understand their deaths, and why they always left her behind for a place she had never been before. 

Inez is a sheltered and deals with a lot of abandonment issues because of her lack of parental support. It made me empathize with her when she acted in a way that I wouldn’t have. I loved her strong willed heart and her need to keep going despite the consequences that fell upon her. I loved stepping into this setting, I enjoyed the subtle hints of magic that benefit those who don’t love a complicated magical system and I really was engaged from start to finish. 

One of my favorite parts of this book was the Egyptian culture and the discussion of artifacts and how they were dealt with during this time. Oh to be a fly on the wall and be there when explorers uncovered some of history’s greatest secrets! This made me want to take a class on ancient Egypt just to learn more. 

I also really bought into the chemistry in the romantic relationship. It’s a fun push and pull type of love that gives us just enough to keep going. It’s slightly NA in nature but closed door and passionate.

As a first book in a series it left a lot of unanswered questions but I never think thats a problem in a first book...it only leaves room for more fun in the second installment. 

Fun, adventurous, romantic with hint of magic...if you like YA fantasy with historical flair, strong willed heroines, sexy brits and are craving to unlock a mystery...I do think this is a great choice to pick next!

My club had a blast discussing this! So many theories about what will happen next!

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

Curious Tides by Pascale Lacelle

Thank you @simon.audio and @bookclubfavorites for my copies!

I feel like Curious Tides will be a book that won’t be for everyone BUT for the right audience it will be a big hit! 

I really enjoyed it, especially knowing this was a debut it truly was impressive! 

This book is set in an academy for different kinds of tide magic. I loved how the lunar cycle and the ocean played a role in how the magic was used. I think it was really unique, and made this book stand out in a crowd of other dark academia books. 

There is a tragic mystery that takes place and I loved putting together the pieces to figure out what really happened. Even in its predictably(not a bad thing)….the author always took a unique route to get there AND there were some reveals that truly took me by surprise. 

There are two POVs and I fell in love with Baz as a character. Throw in a love triangle, cultish vibes, shifting alliances and you’ve got yourself one unique story…that in my opinion, is worth the read. 

The writing was gorgeous and the characters kept getting better. I love when an author creates imperfect characters and situations that just make sense and this was executed really well here. 

I will definitely be reading book 2 and can’t wait to see where she takes these characters next! If you like slower paced, beautiful writing and unique magic systems…pick this one up!

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

DRINKER OF INK by Shannon Castleton

Drinker of Ink is my favorite debut novel of 2023. 

This is the kind of book that reminds me of how words and stories are vital to our very being — and how words can heal even after our actions fail us. 

This is a story written in letter format that somehow reads like a beautifully vivid and poetic fever dream. Shannon gives readers a consuming plot with an equally exquisite writing style all her own. 

The entirety of the novel feels like one well spoken coming of age poem as it examines what it feels like to fall in love and cope with those ever expanding/shifting emotions. 

Drinker of Ink feels like an old soul that is dipped in new life with its charm, poise and heart. This book is deeply romantic in its simplicity. Like the empty spaces between two hands begging to be held. 

This is a strong character driven story where you really get to see the introspective thoughts of our main character Vivienne. The 90s foreign affairs elements feel well researched and impactful. You could highlight the book for days and find a new sentence to gush over…or a new theme to examine. 

Some books feel like they have left you with a portion of the authors heart attached to your own. This one does that. I don’t want to live in a world where stories like this don’t exist.

Thank you @shannon.castleton for my beautiful copy! I had to pair this with my one and only Celine Dion. Two icons need to stick together. Cue my 1990s Celine obsession that carries into adulthood — as will my obsession with this story. 

If you have the chance to trust me and go in blind to this story. Please do, you won’t be disappointed.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

THE FURY BY ALEX MICHAELIDES

Thank you @celadonbooks and @macmillan.audio for my copies.

9/10 I love a good thriller on audio. It adds this cinematic quality and instantly amplifies my experience! 

This audio is fantastic! Highly recommend. 5/5 stars.

The Silent Patient was my first thriller ever and I always look forward to what Alex will write next. This is a psychological thriller, full of characters you can’t help but like and also reject. 

Set on a secluded island in Greece, the Fury is a book about revenge, morally grey dilemmas, and cat and mouse games with no where to escape.

I honestly had no idea what would happen next. This story begins as a slow waves upon a shore…introducing characters, relationships and motives and by the end will have you tossed like turbulent waves on the sea…demanding all your attention. 
 
And just when you think you know what’s happening, layers and reveals will only cement Alex’s intelligent writing and have you emotionally conflicted for more.

Overall a really enjoyable ride, especially for those who like more of a psychological thrill. I will just keep reading whatever he puts out next!

If you know my tastes well: send me a thriller rec!

There are a lot of things that are good, but what is essential to you? 

New books and merch are good, buddy reads are good, challenges and book clubs are good. 

But what happens when too much good becomes well…bad?

I’ve seen a lot about bookstagram becoming the next hustle culture, and in many ways I agree. 

My new motto is “good for them but not for me”

Don’t let mindless scrolling let you become mute to what truly fills your soul and cup. What is essential. Don’t let what other people are doing dictate how you feel about something or how you spend your time. When in reality… does anything that a stranger does online truly affect anything but your mentality?

Sometimes pulling back on the busy can help us REALLY focus on a few good things. And in the end…we might realize that less means more. 

More attention to neglected relationships. 

More time focusing on tiny insignificant sentences that actually pack a large punch

More moments spent offline, or taking time to breathe in the silence. 

So a lot of things are GOOD. But what is essential to you? What is going to bring you the most fulfilling joy? 

That’s my goal for 2024. I’m still figuring it out, but man alive it feels so good already. 

What is essential to YOU when it comes to this space? What could you leave behind?

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

A CURIOUS BEGINNING BY DEANNA RAYBOURN

Thank you @berkleypub and @prhaudio for my free copies

ATTENTION: Fans of Miss Scarlet and the Duke meets India Holton... this one is for you!

I’m honestly shaking my head at myself for not knowing this series existed until a month ago. This is a fast read that almost feels like your favorite BBC show with a scandalous (but not TOO scandalous) nature. 

Veronica is an independent woman of science who doesn’t mix her words. When the death of a new acquaintance forces her on the run, she must team up with an unexpectedly rugged...(and not to mention handsome) ally to solve a mystery surrounding her late mother before it’s too late. 

The best thing by far about this book is the banter. Veronica is not afraid to speak her mind, flaunt her sharp mind and let gentlemen know that women can be just as spirited and capable as any man. I loved the unwilling yet necessary partnership between her and Stoker. 

This book is a fast read, a historically accurate little jaunt, and just a really good time. No romance yet, but with a series this long...I think this one is going to be a real slow burn. 

I will for sure go on to read the next book.

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

The Lily of Ludgate Hill by Mimi Matthews

If you want a solid historical romance with the right atmosphere, characters with spirit and depth, then look no further!

I have been in love with the Belles of London series since the Siren of Sussex. What impresses me most is that each book in the series is incredibly unique and purposefully crafted to fit each main character. None of her books will have the same backstory or type of love. And if you fully embrace that...then that’s what makes this series so special. 

The Lily of Ludgate Hill is a story about second chances, grief, and allowing yourself to move past what others may say of you. Hart and Anne have a complicated history. When they reconnect after years apart, the flame and the hurts still burn just as fervently. Anne is stubborn and Hart lets his passions drive his tongue and thats why I enjoyed them both so very much. 

The push and pull was fantastic and there were plenty of one liners. I wanted to highlight so much of Harts dialogue so that I could read it all over again. The grievances were worked through while keeping the tension tight. I loved how the grief plot flowed with the history of Prince Albert and the authors own personal experience. It was all so smartly done that I can help but tip my hat to another job well done. 

I am over the moon excited about the next edition to the series after the small glimpses we got in this book! 

The perfect historical romance to start of your 2024.

Thank you @austenprose and @berkleyromance for my copy. Thank you @prhaudio for my audio. I adore this whole series on audio as well. Great dual narration.

Daughter of the Pirate King by Tricia Levenseller

This series was just a really good time. (I have also read the 2nd book and enjoyed it even more!)

Fun, past and packs a solid pirate punch. Alosa is the female Jack Sparrow of a rowdy female pirate crew. Her ruthlessness and cunning have given her a name on the high seas and the adventure she takes will have you turning pages devouring this fast paced, high stakes story on the sea.

When Alosa allows herself to be captured by an enemy ship to infiltrate their ranks and find a secret map — she starts an unlikely relationship with a fellow pirate who cant help but want to “walk her plank” (ok i’m sorry I had to). All jokes aside, the romance is flirty yet sultry and I was rooting for them from start to finish. A really wonderful part to the story that added some heart and vulnerability to these characters. 

This was fun, unexpected and a real YA fantasy treat. I can totally see what this is a staple read and I would highly recommend it as well. There are NEVER enough pirate books for me!

✨BOOK REVIEW✨

I GOT YOU by STACY WILLIAMS

Readers who love a good football themed, slow burn romance...THIS ONE IS FOR YOU. 

I love trying new indie authors, and after hearing nothing but rave reviews over Stacy’s debut I decided to give it a go! This is a journey from start to finish as you get to explore Maggie’s feisty yet loyal personality next to Shanes more closed off but loveable one. This is a story with ups and downs but ultimately has a very sweet and satisfying finish.

I think it’s best to go in blind with this one, but I do think the slow burn journey has a lot of great memorable moments. From quiet conversations between characters to heartwarming family dynamics I do believe Stacy has thrown a touch town and made a name for herself in contemporary romance. 

One of my favorite aspects of the storytelling was that Stacy as an author is putting herself in a category all her own. This is a book that has some strong language that is realistic for the character’s backgrounds, but still falls into a fade to black...low spice category. I could see Stacy’s personality in this story and she definitely penned out her heart to us on these pages. 

I also really enjoyed the friendship dynamic and how football itself was constantly incorporated into the story making this a true sports romance. This story had great juxtaposition between the heavy and light moments making this a really fun, but still emotionally impactful story. 

I’ll definitely be reading the next book.
